item.title: So now George Bush Sr is celebrated as a titan of unity. How on earth did we get here? - The Guardian
item.description:
So now George Bush Sr is celebrated as a titan of unity. How on earth did we get here?  The Guardian

George HW Bush was no one‚Äôs idea of a great president. His 1988 presidential campaign was the first I followed as a child in the US ‚Äì supporting, under my mother‚Äôs instruction, his hapless rival, Michael Dukakis ‚Äì and even then he seemed strangely unquantifiable, a blank. His presidency bore this impression out, in which his credit sheet was cancelled out by enough debit that the balance ultimately came to nothing. A war hero and famously polite, Bush Sr signed the Clean Air Act and the Americans With Disabilities Act (protecting, among others, people with HIV, from discrimination), and eve...

item.title: Dana Carvey Remembers George Bush, From Muse to Friend - The New York Times
item.description:
Dana Carvey Remembers George Bush, From Muse to Friend  The New York Times

Late on Nov. 8, 1988, the phone rang. I answered, and a familiar voice said: ‚ÄúWell, congratulations. You won.‚Äù ‚ÄúI won? What do you mean I won?‚Äù ‚ÄúBush won, so you won,‚Äù he answered. ‚ÄúJon?‚Äù ‚ÄúYES, it‚Äôs me! JON LOVITZ! And NOW YOU are going to be the president on ‚ÄòSaturday Night Live‚Äô for the next four years. HAPPY NOW?‚Äù On ‚ÄúSaturday Night Live,‚Äù your friend‚Äôs defeat can be your victory. Comedians can be insanely competitive ‚Äî the reason ‚Äúclass clown‚Äù is singular is because if there were two class clowns, one clown would ultimately kill the other clown. Jon had played the Democratic presidentia...

item.title: Secret Service formally terminates ‚ÄòTimberwolf Detail‚Äô protecting President George H.W. Bush - MarketWatch
item.description:
Secret Service formally terminates ‚ÄòTimberwolf Detail‚Äô protecting President George H.W. Bush  MarketWatch

ASSOCIATED PRESS By Associated Press A hearse carrying the casket of President George H.W. Bush arriving Thursday at Texas A&M University in College Station, Texas. Reuters COLLEGE STATION, Texas (AP) ‚Äî The U.S. Secret Service has ended its detail for George H.W. Bush after nearly 40 years of protecting the former president, who was known by the code name ‚ÄúTimberwolf.‚Äù The agency says its security detail officially ended at 6 a.m. Friday ‚Äúwith no incidents to report‚Äù following Bush‚Äôs burial Thursday at his presidential library at Texas A&M University. In its final notification, the Bush Pro...

item.title: A Presidency Without Humor - The New York Times
item.description:
A Presidency Without Humor  The New York Times

As with September‚Äôs memorial services for John McCain, expressions of mourning for George H.W. Bush ‚Äî extolling the 41st president‚Äôs humility, loyalty, temperance, decency, bravery and devotion to public service ‚Äî have contained thinly veiled rebukes of the current president. The sharpest one, I thought, came in Alan Simpson‚Äôs splendid eulogy at Washington National Cathedral. ‚ÄúHe never lost his sense of humor,‚Äù the former senator from Wyoming said of his friend of more than 50 years. ‚ÄúHumor is the universal solvent against the abrasive elements of life. That‚Äôs what humor is. He never hated ...

item.title: Trump demands border wall money; shutdown showdown nears - The Associated Press
item.description:
Trump demands border wall money; shutdown showdown nears  The Associated Press

KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) ‚Äî President Donald Trump said Friday that Congress should provide all the money he wants for his promised U.S.-Mexico border wall, and he called illegal immigration a "threat to the well-being of every American community." Trump spoke hours after signing a short-term spending bill that covers key government departments for two more weeks, until Dec. 21, setting up a pre-Christmas showdown over the wall. The president wants the next spending package to include at least $5 billion for the proposed wall. House Democratic leader Nancy Pelosi of California rejected that a d...

item.description:

Peter Olyniec waves an American flag as George H.W. Bush's train passes near Whitehall, Texas, on Thursday, December 6. Bush's body was en route to his presidential library in College Station, Texas, where he was laid to rest. Scott Olson/Getty Images Navy guard Kenneth Knox stands over the flag-draped casket of the late President as a train carries it to his presidential library at Texas A&M University. Joe Raedle/Getty Images People pay their respects as the train carrying the casket passes Spring, Texas. David J. Phillip/Pool/Reuters Police salute as a hearse carries Bush's casket to a t...

item.title: On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week - The New York Times
item.description:
On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week  The New York Times

From developments in the Russia inquiry to doubts about the China trade truce, it‚Äôs been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories you might have missed (and some links if you‚Äôd like to read further). ___________________ The nation bade farewell to former President Bush. Former President George H.W. Bush was remembered at his funeral on Wednesday as a ‚Äúkinder and gentler‚Äù leader who steered the country through storms at home and abroad. As bells tolled, choirs sang and flags flew at half-staff on Wednesday, the nation solemnly said goodbye to the 41st president....

item.title: Trump nominee William Barr pushed for the death penalty to ‚Äúsend a message to drug dealers‚Äù - Quartz
item.description:
Trump nominee William Barr pushed for the death penalty to ‚Äúsend a message to drug dealers‚Äù  Quartz

William P. Barr, the former attorney general under George H. W. Bush, could be returning to his old job, after Donald Trump nominated him on Friday (Dec. 7) to fill the position held by Jeff Sessions. Barr, who served as attorney general from 1991 until 1993, was a staunch proponent of the death penalty, and pushed hard to get a Bush-backed bill that would have expanded the types of crime that could punished by execution. What Barr, who has been a Verizon employee and a private attorney since he left Bush‚Äôs administration, believes now about the death penalty isn‚Äôt clear yet. But he‚Äôs sure ...

item.title: Trump surrounding himself with yes-men and yes-women - CNN
item.description:
Trump surrounding himself with yes-men and yes-women  CNN

Jen Psaki, a CNN political commentator, was the White House communications director and State Department spokeswoman during the Obama administration. She is vice president of communications and strategy at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. Follow her at @jrpsaki. The opinions expressed in this commentary are solely those of the author. Read more opinion articles at CNN. In the olden days of presidential appointments and nominations, the focus was justifiably on the nominees -- their background, what their policy positions said about the role they would play in an administratio...

item.title: Pearl Harbor brought out the best in George Bush and others - CNN
item.description:
Pearl Harbor brought out the best in George Bush and others  CNN

H. W. Brands teaches history at the University of Texas at Austin. His new book is "Heirs of the Founders: The Epic Rivalry of Henry Clay, John Calhoun and Daniel Webster, the Second Generation of American Giants." The views expressed here are solely his. View more opinion articles on CNN. It's an accident of timing that the funeral of George H. W. Bush occurred within days of the anniversary of Pearl Harbor. But it's no accident that Americans have marked the passing of the former President with an outpouring of respect and admiration typically reserved for war heroes. They remember his pr...

item.title: Trump nominates William Barr to be his next attorney general - CNN
item.description:
Trump nominates William Barr to be his next attorney general  CNN

President Donald Trump has decided to nominate former Attorney General William Barr to be the next permanent head of the Justice Department, the President told reporters Friday. "I want to confirm that Bill Barr, one of the most respected jurists in the country, highly respected lawyer, former attorney general under the Bush administration, a terrific man, a terrific person, a brilliant man," Trump said as he departed the White House. "I did not know him until recently when I went through the process of looking at people and he was my first choice from day one, respected by Republicans and ...

item.title: Thousands Line Bush Funeral Train Route for Final Farewell - VOA News
item.description:
Thousands Line Bush Funeral Train Route for Final Farewell  VOA News

Thousands of people lined up along the route of the funeral train that was taking the remains of former President George H.W. Bush from Houston about 80 miles northwest to his final resting place, his presidential library in College Station, Texas, on Thursday, Dec. 6. The train is a Union Pacific Corp locomotive, numbered 4141 and bearing the name "George Bush 41" on the side. Bush, the 41st U.S. president, died last week in Texas at age 94. His remains were flown to Texas on Wednesday evening after a state funeral at Washington's National Cathedral attended by U.S. President Donald Trump,...

item.title: Whose Attorney General Will William Barr Be? - The New York Times
item.description:
Whose Attorney General Will William Barr Be?  The New York Times

One thing that can be said about William Barr, whom President Trump has chosen to serve as his next attorney general, is that he knows the ways of the Department of Justice. Unlike Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker, Jeff Sessions‚Äôs former chief of staff and a troubling interim replacement in more ways than one, Mr. Barr is intimately familiar with the nation‚Äôs chief law enforcement agency, having served as President George H.W. Bush‚Äôs attorney general between 1991 and 1993 and as deputy attorney general and assistant attorney general before that. It was in the earliest role, when Mr....

item.title: Analysis: Trump stayed under the radar this week but his fury is 'bubbling behind the scenes' - ABC News
item.description:
Analysis: Trump stayed under the radar this week but his fury is 'bubbling behind the scenes'  ABC News

By Washington bureau chief Zoe Daniel and Emily Olson "What does it tell you that the feel-good events in Washington these days are funerals?" asked journalist Susan Glasser in a piece for the New Yorker this week. Somehow, a politician's death ‚Äî and the associated ritual of pomp, ceremony and complete cable news domination ‚Äî has become a symbolic means of reminding the country "that civility is not a dirty word and that partisan combat is not a permanent state of being". The New York Times reports that US President Donald Trump was apparently proud of himself for staying under the radar wh...

item.title: Trump Announces Nominees for UN, Attorney General - VOA News
item.description:
Trump Announces Nominees for UN, Attorney General  VOA News

U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday confirmed he will nominate State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert to be the new Ambassador to the United Nations. He also announced William Barr to be the new U.S. Attorney General, a post Barr held under former President George H.W. Bush. VOA'S Jeff Custer reports from Washington. item.description:

He was confirmed by a vote of 50 to 48, not 50 to 42. It‚Äôs not hard for a new president, in concert with Congress, to erase a predecessor‚Äôs legislative, regulatory and diplomatic accomplishments. It‚Äôs a president‚Äôs Supreme Court legacy that lasts. Many retrospectives on the life of President George H.W. Bush, who died last Friday, noted that one of the two men he named ...

item.title: Former U.S. Attorney General Barr may return to job - Reuters
item.description:
Former U.S. Attorney General Barr may return to job  Reuters

Former U.S. Attorney General William Barr, who served under former President George H.W. Bush, is the leading candidate for the job as a permanent replacement for Jeff Sessions, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday. Gavino Garay reports.

item.title: Notebook: In Washington, Sending Off the Old Normal - The New York Times
item.description:
Notebook: In Washington, Sending Off the Old Normal  The New York Times

On Thursday morning, as I was walking through downtown Washington and up to Capitol Hill, workers were carting away the last of the metal security barriers that had been erected around the Capitol, where George H.W. Bush lay in state earlier in the week. His coffin was sent off to Houston on Air Force One the previous afternoon, and on the Hill there was a feeling that the circus had left town ‚Äî or, maybe, the opposite. ‚ÄúOh, did he tweet something?‚Äù an editor was saying when I walked into the office, mumbling to no one in particular but loud enough to hear over TVs tuned to the Bush funeral...

item.title: Bernie Sanders Explains to Colbert Why Trump Is No George H.W. Bush - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Bernie Sanders Explains to Colbert Why Trump Is No George H.W. Bush  The Daily Beast

Scott Kowalchyk/CBS Senator Bernie Sanders is one of the many progressives ‚Äúseriously considering‚Äù a run for the presidency in 2020. And he took one step closer to that eventuality on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert Thursday night. Ostensibly, Sanders was there to promote his latest book, Where We Go from Here: Two Years in the Resistance, but really he was there to pump up his base. Asked how he‚Äôs feeling after the midterm elections, Sanders answered, ‚ÄúA lot better now than before the midterms. Democrats won 40 seats, now control the House, won several governors‚Äô seats and several hundr...

item.title: Texas Bids President George HW Bush Final Farewell - VOA News
item.description:
Texas Bids President George HW Bush Final Farewell  VOA News

At the end of rows of carefully placed flags along this Houston sidewalk, just outside the metal gates of West Oak Drive South, is a makeshift memorial filled with flowers and teddy bears, honoring a local resident who was, at least to Donna Platt who lives nearby, more than just a president. ‚ÄúVery nice, we would run into him, and not just me but all the neighbors, in the bank doing his banking business or in the grocery store ‚Äî he liked to go to the grocery store ‚Äî and it was just like saying hi to another neighbor,‚Äù she told VOA after taking a few pictures to document the memorial for pos...

item.title: Donald Trump nominates William Barr as next attorney general - The Guardian
item.description:
Donald Trump nominates William Barr as next attorney general  The Guardian

Donald Trump has named William Barr as his next attorney general, a move that raises fresh concerns about the future of special counsel Robert Mueller‚Äôs investigation into Russian election interference. Related: Trump to nominate new attorney general and UN ambassador as Kelly eyes exit ‚Äì live If confirmed by the Senate, Barr ‚Äì who held the same role under the late George HW Bush from 1991 to 1993 ‚Äì will take over from Matthew Whitaker, who has served in an acting capacity since Jeff Sessions was forced out a month ago. Democrats have threatened to examine whether Whitaker can legally serve...

item.description:
üá∫üá∏ 'A great-soldier statesman': US bids farewell to George HW Bush | Al Jazeeras English  Al Jazeera English

The body of former US President George H W Bush has been flown to Texas where he will be buried this week. He died in his Houston home on Friday at the age of 94. Earlier, politicians past and present were among the mourners at a state funeral for the 41st president in Washington, DC. item.title: Trump picks former US attorney-general Barr to head Justice Department - ABC News
item.description:
Trump picks former US attorney-general Barr to head Justice Department  ABC News

President Donald Trump has chosen former US attorney-general William Barr to once again lead the Justice Department, a role that would put him in charge of the federal probe into Russian election interference. Key points: - Mr Barr previously served as attorney-general under the late president George HW Bush - If appointed, Mr Barr would have ultimate responsibility for the Russia probe - Mr Trump said Mr Barr was "my first choice from day one" If confirmed by the Senate, Mr Barr would take over from Matthew Whitaker, who has been serving in an acting capacity since Mr Trump forced out Jeff...

item.description:
The week in 25 photos  CNN

Former US President George W. Bush speaks at the state funeral of his father, former US President George H.W. Bush, on Wednesday, December 5. "He showed me what it means to be a President who serves with integrity, leads with courage and acts with love in his heart for the citizens of our country," Bush said in his eulogy. Scott Walker on Thursday to avoid staining his legacy and behaving like a sore loser by signing legislation that would weaken the powers of the Democrat who defeated him. Rather than notching another partisan victory in his final weeks in offic...

item.title: Rosenstein, Justice Department vets celebrate Barr nomination - CNN
item.description:
Rosenstein, Justice Department vets celebrate Barr nomination  CNN

Justice Department veterans on Friday celebrated President Donald Trump's announcement that he would select William Barr, a member of the Justice Department's old guard and a former attorney general under George H.W. Bush, to be his next attorney general. Barr, who worked his way from a night school law student and up through the ranks of the Department of Justice, is widely viewed by legal observers as a deeply experienced attorney with bipartisan respect. Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein is said to be "elated" by the choice of Barr and former Attorney General Jeff Sessions has alway...

item.title: Texas Bids President George H.W. Bush Final Farewell - VOA News
item.description:
Texas Bids President George H.W. Bush Final Farewell  VOA News

After formal services at the National Cathedral in Washington, the final journey for President George H.W. Bush takes place in the state that launched his political career, and where he is now finally laid to rest. VOA's Kane Farabaugh reports on how those in Texas participated in the final ceremonies to honor and remember their former president and war hero. Originally published at - https://www.voanews.com/a/texas-bids-president-george-h-w-bush-final-farewell/4690646.html

item.title: Deval Patrick Won‚Äôt Run in 2020, Citing ‚ÄòCruelty‚Äô of the Process - The New York Times
item.description:
Deval Patrick Won‚Äôt Run in 2020, Citing ‚ÄòCruelty‚Äô of the Process  The New York Times

Deval Patrick, the former two-term Democratic governor of Massachusetts, said Thursday morning that he would not be a candidate for the Democratic nomination for president in 2020, blaming the ‚Äúcruelty of our elections process‚Äù and how it could affect his loved ones. A statement by Mr. Patrick, posted to his Facebook page at 7 a.m., confirmed reports from associates earlier this week that he had decided against mounting a presidential campaign after discussing it for months with advisers and his wife, Diane Patrick, and other family members, while traveling around the country to support Dem...

Attorney General William Barr sits in the Oval Office with President George H.W. Bush in 1992. Marcy Nighswander/AP As attorney general for George H.W. Bush, Barr was an architect of America‚Äôs punitive criminal justice system. President Donald Trump will nominate William Barr as his next attorney general ‚Äî and criminal justice reformers are very worried. The news means Barr, who formerly served as President George H.W. item.title: Bush's presidential funeral train first in nearly 50 years - The Associated Press
item.description:
Bush's presidential funeral train first in nearly 50 years  The Associated Press

SPRING, Texas (AP) ‚Äî The locomotive was painted to resemble Air Force One, but George H.W. Bush joked that if it had been around during his presidency, he may have preferred to ride the rails rather than take to the skies. "I might have left Air Force One behind," Bush quipped during the 2005 unveiling of 4141, a blue and gray locomotive commissioned in honor of the 41st president and unveiled at Texas A&M University. On Thursday, that same 4,300-horsepower machine left a suburban Houston railyard loaded with Bush's casket for his final journey after almost a week of ceremonies in Washingto...

item.title: Trump to Nominate William Barr as Attorney General - VOA News
item.description:
Trump to Nominate William Barr as Attorney General  VOA News

A former U.S. attorney general known for supporting sweeping presidential powers is President Donald Trump's choice to again run the U.S. Department of Justice. Trump said Friday that William Barr, who was attorney general during the administration of the late former President George H.W. Bush, is his selection, describing him as "a terrific man, a terrific person, a brilliant man." The president told reporters at the White House that Barr, a 68-year-old conservative Republican and corporate lawyer, "was my first choice from day one. Respected by Republicans and respected by Democrats." Lat...

item.title: Trump Will Nominate William Barr as Attorney General - The New York Times
item.description:
Trump Will Nominate William Barr as Attorney General  The New York Times

WASHINGTON ‚Äî President Trump on Friday said he intended to nominate William P. Barr, who served as attorney general during the first Bush administration from 1991 to 1993, to return as head of the Justice Department. ‚ÄúHe was my first choice since Day 1,‚Äù Mr. Trump told reporters as he walked from the White House to a helicopter for a trip to Kansas City, Mo. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be nominated.‚Äù Mr. Trump‚Äôs focus on Mr. Barr, who supports a strong vision of executive powers, had emerged over the past week following the ouster last month of Jeff Sessions as attorney general and the turbulent reception that ...

item.title: Kelly may depart in expected White House shakeup - The Associated Press
item.description:
Kelly may depart in expected White House shakeup  The Associated Press

WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî President Donald Trump is inching closer to his long-teased major White House shake-up, gearing up for the twin challenges of battling for re-election and dealing with the Democrats' investigations once they take control of the House. The biggest piece of the shifting picture: Chief of Staff John Kelly's departure now appears certain. Trump announced Friday he was picking a new U.S. attorney genera l and a new ambassador to the U.N. , and at the same time two senior aides departed the White House to beef up his 2020 campaign. But the largest changes were still to come. Kel...

item.title: William Barr nominated as US attorney general - The Telegraph
item.description:
William Barr nominated as US attorney general  The Telegraph

Donald Trump has announced he will nominate William Barr to be his new attorney general, a role which includes overseeing the investigation into Russian election meddling that continues to blight his presidency. Mr Barr, 68, held the position for two years under George W Bush, the former US president, and has voiced views on the Russia probe and other key areas which chime with Mr Trump‚Äôs stances. I am pleased to announce that I will be nominating The Honorable William P. Barr for the position of Attorney General of the United States. As the former AG for George H.W. Bush.... ‚Äî Donald J. Tr...

item.title: George H.W. Bush, the Original Sock Diplomat - The New York Times
item.description:
George H.W. Bush, the Original Sock Diplomat  The New York Times

Over the last few days, the world has said goodbye to the former President George H.W. Bush at a memorial in Houston, a state funeral in Washington, D.C., and a private funeral in Houston. Moving eulogies have been given by the great and the good and those close to the man, stories told and official statements rendered. But what has been equally striking are the unofficial gestures being made by people all around the country who have chosen to express their admiration and affection for the former president via ‚Ä¶ socks. Indeed, there has been a veritable outpouring of creative hosiery this w...

item.title: For George Bush, One Last Funeral, and Then a 70-Mile Train Ride - The New York Times
item.description:
For George Bush, One Last Funeral, and Then a 70-Mile Train Ride  The New York Times

Correction: December 6, 2018 This article has been revised to reflect the following correction: A photo caption with an earlier version of this article misidentified the city where former President George Bush would be buried. It is College Station, Tex., not College Point. HOUSTON ‚Äî In a more intimate and Texas-tinged gathering, at the same church where his wife of 73 years was eulogized just seven months ago, former President George Bush was remembered Thursday morning for his humility, decency and devotion to his family and his country. Nearly 1,000 relatives, friends and dignitaries fro...

item.title: The Leadership Lesson This Young Entrepreneur Learned From George H. W. Bush Will Make You Smile - Forbes
item.description:
The Leadership Lesson This Young Entrepreneur Learned From George H. W. Bush Will Make You Smile  Forbes

Before Dave Dutch was a serially successful CEO, he was a member of the US Navy Special Operations. In, Would You Risk Arrest To Reinforce Your Company‚Äôs Culture?, I recently recounted how Dave reinforced his company‚Äôs culture by not cutting his hair for over 16-months. He eventually sold that company for over $300 million. In an email in which he thanked me for writing the company culture article, he also included an insightful vignette about George H.W. Bush and how it impacted his leadership style throughout his startup career. I was so moved by the anecdote, I‚Äôm compelled to share it wi...

item.title: Flag-waving crowds in Texas watch Bush's funeral train - The Associated Press
item.description:
Flag-waving crowds in Texas watch Bush's funeral train  The Associated Press

Flag waving-crowds lined the tracks as a special funeral train carried the flag-draped body of former President George H.W. Bush to College Station, Texas, where he'll be buried on the grounds of his presidential library. As the train passed through the towns a group of elementary students could be seen holding a banner that read "THANK YOU," firefighters saluted atop their truck on an overpass and a woman in a red hat held a sign that said "Rest in Peace George" with hearts. Here are some scenes along the route as the train went from the Houston suburb of Spring to College Station: ___ MAK...

item.title: Former President George H.W. Bush laid to rest in Texas - Reuters
item.description:
Former President George H.W. Bush laid to rest in Texas  Reuters

Former U.S. President George H.W. Bush was laid to rest at his presidential library in College Station, Texas, on Thursday, following funeral services at his longtime church in Houston. Bush's casket traveled in a special train car about an hour northwest from Houston to College Station and was then carried to the gravesite behind his library by a military honor guard, in a ceremony overseen by his son and former President George W. Bush. Bush, the 41st U.S. president, died last week in Texas at 94. His remains were flown to Texas on Wednesday following a state funeral at the Washington Nat...

item.title: Secret Service detail for Bush, code name 'Timberwolf,' ends - The Associated Press
item.description:
Secret Service detail for Bush, code name 'Timberwolf,' ends  The Associated Press

COLLEGE STATION, Texas (AP) ‚Äî The U.S. Secret Service has ended its detail for George H.W. Bush after nearly 40 years of protecting the former president, who was known by the code name "Timberwolf." The agency says its security detail officially ended at 6 a.m. Friday "with no incidents to report" following Bush's burial Thursday at his presidential library at Texas A&M University. In its final notification , the Bush Protective Division said: "You will be missed by all of us." Agents served as honorary pallbearers during some of this week's events honoring the 41st president. On Twitter, t...

item.title: Trump signs funding stopgap, setting holiday fight on wall - The Associated Press
item.description:
Trump signs funding stopgap, setting holiday fight on wall  The Associated Press

WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî President Donald Trump has signed a stopgap spending bill to fund key government departments for two-weeks, setting up a pre-Christmas showdown over border wall funding. Trump's signature on the measure keeps the government open through Dec. 21. Both houses of Congress passed the measure by voice vote on Thursday. Trump says wants the next funding package to include at least $5 billion for his proposed wall, something House Democratic leader Nancy Pelosi rejected Thursday. The stopgap bill avoided a partisan funding fight this week when Washington paused for ceremonies hon...

item.title: Trump brags about approval rating from 'biased' polling firm hours after George HW Bush funeral - The Independent
item.description:
Trump brags about approval rating from 'biased' polling firm hours after George HW Bush funeral  The Independent

President Donald Trump has bragged about his approval rating using a contentious poll that generally skews in his favour, and pegs his support anywhere between seven and 11 per cent higher than other surveys. Mr Trump tweeted that he had a 50 per cent approval rating on Wednesday, a message he displayed in an image with big, bold lettering. Much smaller was the source, Rasmussen Reports, which has generally shown a higher rate of approval than other outlets. He did so just hours after attending the funeral for former President George HW Bush. Other polling firms ‚Äî which have conducted polls...

item.description:
The Latest: Private, graveside service ends; Bush buried  The Associated Press

HOUSTON (AP) ‚Äî The Latest on events honoring former President George H.W. Bush (all times local): 5:25 p.m. Texas A&M says the private, graveside service for George H.W. Bush's family members has ended and the former president has been buried. Thursday evening's ceremony concludes days of funeral activities honoring the 41st president. After lying in state at the U.S. Capitol and a funeral at Washington's National Cathedral, Bush had a funeral at the Houston church where his family worshipped. His remains then rode on a special funeral train to College Station, where he was buried at his pr...

item.title: letters: George Bush: How We Weigh the Legacy of a President - The New York Times
item.description:
letters: George Bush: How We Weigh the Legacy of a President  The New York Times

To the Editor: Re ‚ÄúA Day of Pageantry Fit for a Political Patriarch‚Äù (front page, Dec. 6): Former President George H.W. Bush‚Äôs death and the solemn pageantry of his funeral are providing Americans with a fleeting glimpse of nostalgia for a more stable and saner era in our national life. The processions of aging mourners, like the president they served and in many cases revered, include mostly good public servants who, like their boss, had a loyalty to their country that transcended politics. Sadly, in recent years, anger, blame and even an absence of humor have defined our politics and have...

item.title: Political GIFs of the week - CNN
item.description:

While most of the nation's attention was focused on honoring former President George H.W. Bush this week, the gears of government slowed, but by no means did they grind to a halt. Here are a few things you might have missed. This moment between George W. Bush and Michelle Obama was reminiscent of a moment the duo shared at Sen. John McCain's funeral earlier this year. Friends are the family you choose, y'all. Now that the 2018 election is (mostly) in the rear-view mirror, we're focusing in on 2020. It's less than 700 days away, after all! item.title: George HW Bush funeral: 1,000 mourners descend on Texas for final goodbye to president 'carved in hard granite of history' - The Independent
item.description:
George HW Bush funeral: 1,000 mourners descend on Texas for final goodbye to president 'carved in hard granite of history'  The Independent

The deeds that George HW Bush are carved into the "granite of history" former Secretary of State James Baker said as Texas said goodbye to one of its most famous residents. A day after thousands of Americans and every living president mourned the death of Mr Bush at the National Cathedral in Washington, friends and family were given a chance to pay their final respects to the former president. More than 1,000 mourners sang ‚ÄúAmerica the Beautiful‚Äù at St. Martin‚Äôs Episcopal Church on Thursday, where the 41st commander in chief, who died last week in Texas at age 94, worshipped for over 50 yea...

item.title: Trump nominates William Barr as next attorney general - Vox.com
item.description:
Trump nominates William Barr as next attorney general  Vox.com

Attorney General William Barr sits in the Oval Office with President George H.W. Bush in 1992. Marcy Nighswander/AP Barr, if approved by the Republican-controlled Senate, will replace former Attorney General Jeff Sessions. President Donald Trump says he will nominate William Barr, a conservative lawyer and former attorney general under President George H.W. Bush, to be the next attorney general. The president announced his pick Friday, after reports circulated that Barr was the top contender for the job. Barr served as attorney general about 25 years ago, from 1991 to 1993, and at the time ...

item.title: Pelosi takes hard line on paying for Trump's border wall - The Associated Press
item.description:
Pelosi takes hard line on paying for Trump's border wall  The Associated Press

WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî House Democratic leader Nancy Pelosi on Thursday rejected the idea of paying for President Donald Trump's border wall in exchange for helping hundreds of thousands of young immigrants avoid deportation. Funding for the wall ‚Äî a top Trump priority ‚Äî and legal protections for so-called Dreamers, a key Democratic goal, should not be linked, Pelosi said. "They're two different subjects," she said. Her comments came as the House and Senate approved a stopgap bill Thursday to keep the government funded through Dec. 21. The measure, approved by voice votes in near-empty chambers,...

item.title: Bush‚Äôs greatest virtue was experience - Financial Times
item.description:
Bush‚Äôs greatest virtue was experience  Financial Times

IF Stone once said that funerals were ‚Äúalways an occasion for pious lying‚Äù. George HW Bush‚Äôs was an exception. Regardless of politics, virtually everyone who dealt with America‚Äôs 41st president was struck by his strong sense of personal decency. Regardless of his interlocutor, Bush Sr never short-changed courtesy. ‚ÄúI am a conservative,‚Äù he once said, ‚Äúbut I am not a nut about it.‚Äù Our standards have fallen. Shortly before the funeral, I tweeted out a prediction: ‚ÄúIf Trump doesn‚Äôt heckle, spontaneously combust or wander out of the cathedral at the wrong moment, pundits will proclaim how pres...

item.title: Major search underway after two US military planes crash into Pacific Ocean - The Independent
item.description:
Major search underway after two US military planes crash into Pacific Ocean  The Independent

A major search is underway after two US Marine planes collided mid-air and crashed into the Pacific Ocean off Japan's south-western coast. Rescuers have so far found two of the seven crew members from an F/A-18 fighter jet and a KC-130 refuelling aircraft. One of the crew members was described as being in a stable condition while details about the second have not yet been released. The jets crashed on 6 December at 2am during a regular refuelling training exercise. . The planes took off from their base in Iwakuni, near Hiroshima in western Japan and crashed 200 miles off the coast, accordin...
